alert.note: Alert for Clark; Hot Spring (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 10 at 8:13PM CDT until June 13 at 10:49AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Arkansas... Ouachita River At Arkadelphia affecting Hot Spring and Clark Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ouachita River At Arkadelphia. * WHEN...Until late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Farmland along the river begins to flood. Water over State Highway 7 and 51 at railroad underpass. At 19.0 feet, State Highway 7 and 51 railroad underpass flooded. Fields and timber along the river flooded. At 21.0 feet, State Highway 7 and 51 east of Arkadelphia flooded. Railroad underpass closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 15.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 20.5 feet by Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 7 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Crest Time Date Ouachita River Arkadelphia 17.0 15.8 Fri 7 PM 20.1 14.1 12.2 20.5 7 AM 6/11 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
